A Pilot’s Guide to Inertial Reference Systems, Part One
Inertial Navigation Systems have been in use since the 1940’s, when they were originally developed for rockets launched during World War II... Read more <[[https://performanceaccel.honeywell.com/Pilots/Newsletters/2017/Aug2017/IRS1Aug17]]>
FANS Datalink Update <[[https://performanceaccel.honeywell.com/Pilots/Newsletters/2017/Aug2017/FANSAug17]]> FAA Data Comm National "KUSA" Logon
The FAA has announced the original planned cutover date of September 23-24, 2017 has been pushed back... Read more <[[https://performanceaccel.honeywell.com/Pilots/Newsletters/2017/Aug2017/FANSAug17]]> NZ FMS 6.1 August Highlights <[[https://performanceaccel.honeywell.com/Pilots/Newsletters/2017/Aug2017/FMS61Aug17]]> Multiple Approaches to the Same Runway

Engine Insights <[[https://performanceaccel.honeywell.com/Pilots/Newsletters/2017/Aug2017/EngAug17]]> Importance of Calculating Reference RPM Torque Settings for Takeoff Operations
Excessive temperatures and pressure cause distortion over time. This distortion is reduced or increased based on exposure levels over the life of the blades... Read more <[[https://performanceaccel.honeywell.com/Pilots/Newsletters/2017/Aug2017/EngAug17]]>
Service Information Letter Briefing <[[https://performanceaccel.honeywell.com/Pilots/Newsletters/2017/Aug2017/SILAug17]]>
FANS CPDLC Incorrect Position Downlink
Honeywell has released a new Service Information Letter (SIL) detailing an issue that may occur with certain downlinked position reports and flight plan reports... Read more <[[https://performanceaccel.honeywell.com/Pilots/Newsletters/2017/Aug2017/SILAug17]]>
